Summary: Display warning when flying below minimum distance from ground.
Content: When a UAV is flying below a minimum threshold altitude  the system shall automatically display a warning message notifying the RPIC.

Summary: Alert shall be displayed when a UAV autonomously increases altitude to maintain distance from ground.
Content: When a UAV is flying below a critical threshold altitude and the system autonomously adjusts the flying altitude  the system shall notify the RPIC that it will automatically increase its altitude to maintain a minimum distance from the terrain

Summary: Report UAV autonomous altitude adjustments to operator
Content: All of the UAV's autonomous decisions associated with collision avoidance are reported to the operator

Summary: Enable operator to overide autonomous decisions
Content: The operator has the ability to override autonomous decisions to the fullest extent possible (e.g.  return to the pre-decision altitude)

Summary: The UAV shall provide a description of its autonomous decisions
Content: When requested by the user  the UAV must provide a comprehensible explanation of its autonomous decisions

Summary: A warning shall be provided if the throttle stick is incorrectly positioned when control is requested by the opertor.
Content: Handover must be iniated by the human who will manually fly the drone (e.g.  through the pilot flipping a switch). The system should not allow the software operator to automatically hand control to the operator as the operator might be unprepared to take control. Coordination must occur between the two roles.

Summary: The UAV shall modify target waypoints that are below the altitude of the terrain
Content: The system must have an inbuilt failsafe to prevent the UAV from flying directly into the ground. In the instance that the throttle is set downwards during a hand-over event  the UAV may descend rapidly but will stop and hover before reaching the ground.

Summary: When manual control is assumed all loaded missions shall be removed
Content: Whenever manual control is assumed by the RPIC  all remaining waypoints shall be cancelled by the system immediately and the UAV should switch to hover in place. The RPIC shall receive training on how to identify the heading of a UAV by rotating the UAV clockwise and accelering periodically.

Summary: Display a warning if satellite locks fall below acceptable numbers
Content: If the number of locked sattelites falls below a threshold  the system shall automatically display a warning message  notifying the RPIC. The position inaccuracy shall be displayed in the user interface  e.g. by displaying a circle around the UAV  showing its approx. estimated position.

Summary: A warning shall be generated if RTL altitudes conflict between multiple UAVs
Content: When a UAV switches to RTL  its RTL altitude is displayed in the status bar and a warning is issued if RTL altitudes conflict (i.e.  lack minimum altitude separation) for multiple UAVs in RTL mode.

Summary: Each GPS is equipped with RTK (real-time-kinematics) for accurate geolocation
Content: Each GPS is equipped with RTK (real-time-kinematics) for accurate geolocation

Summary: The system is equipped with ground-facing sensors to compute distance from the terrain.
Content: The system is equipped with ground-facing sensors to compute distance from the terrain.

Summary: The system shall provide the capability to automatically assign safe RTL altitudes.
Content: The system shall provide the capability to automatically assign safe RTL altitudes.
